oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Songwriter Session - Laura Veltz - 2018-03-25
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by Laura Veltz from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on March 25, 2017. Includes questions from the audience.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Laura Veltz;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Opening comments and introduction of Laura Veltz by Abi Tapia / (02:28) Opening comments by Laura Veltz / (03:10) Drunk Last Night / (09:08) Rich / (16:05) We Went To The Beach / (19:22) Answers question about why she isn't an recording/touring artist / (20:50) Answers question about being left-handed / (21:21) Answers question about if artists ask her to write songs for them / Answers question about how long she's been writing and her writing history / (24:11) Answers question about how songwriters make money / (29:34) The Listener / (33:51) Answers question about how many songs she's working on at one time and how many pitches artists are getting from songwriters / (37:16) Answers question about The Listener being available or not / (37:55) Answers question about music or lyrics coming first / (39:04) Answers question about her influences / (42:03) Answers question about if she's thought about what she would say when she wins song of the year /

(42:55) Answers question about different songwriters process of writing and the craft of country songwriting / (47:22) Lonely Eyes / (50:54) Closing comments / (51:17) Walk-out music / (52:28) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Veltz, Laura; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
